oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Tintype of Confederate cavalryman Pvt. Henry Pitt
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pvt. Pitt served in Co. B, 7th Tenn. Cav. As part of Gen. Nathan B. Forrest's command. He mustered in from Tipton County and was killed at the Battle of Brice's Crossroads in Mississippi. He is photographed wearing an unusual hat, possibly fur, and is holding a short, double-barrelled shotgun, which some men in Forrest's cavalry were known to have carried.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Pitt, Henry
